fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. A set of static or semi-static attributes of the entity. Usually boolean or keyword field data types. Use this field set when you need to track static or semi-static characteristics of an entity for advanced searching and correlation of normalized values across different providers/sources and entity types.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. A set of ephemeral characteristics of the entity, derived from observed behaviors during a specific time period. Usually boolean field data type. Use this field set when you need to capture and track ephemeral characteristics of an entity for advanced searching, correlation of normalized values across different providers/sources and entity types.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. An optional field used when a pretty name is desired for entity-centric operations. This field should not be used for correlation with *.name fields for entities with dedicated field sets (e.g., host).

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

* entity.display_name.text (type: match_only_text)

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A unique identifier for the entity. When multiple identifiers exist, this should be the most stable and commonly used identifier that: 1) persists across the entity's lifecycle, 2) ensures uniqueness within its scope, 3) is commonly used for queries and correlation, and 4) is readily available in most observations (logs/events). For entities with dedicated field sets (e.g., host, user), this value should match the corresponding *.id field. Alternative identifiers (e.g., ARNs values in AWS, URLs) can be preserved in the raw field.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. Indicates the date/time when this entity was last "seen," usually based upon the last event/log that is initiated by this entity.

type: date

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. A set of temporal characteristics of the entity. Usually date field data type. Use this field set when you need to track temporal characteristics of an entity for advanced searching and correlation of normalized values across different providers/sources and entity types.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. Field set for any fields containing numeric entity metrics. These use dynamic field data type mapping.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. The name of the entity. The keyword field enables exact matches for filtering and aggregations, while the text field enables full-text search. For entities with dedicated field sets (e.g., host), this field should mirrors the corresponding .name value.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

entity.name.text (type: match_only_text)

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. Original, unmodified fields from the source system. Usually flattened field data type. While the attributes field should be used for normalized fields requiring advanced queries, this field preserves all source metadata with basic search capabilities.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. A URI, URL, or other direct reference to access or locate the entity in its source system. This could be an API endpoint, web console URL, or other addressable location. Format may vary by entity type and source system.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. The module or integration that provided this entity data (similar to event.module).

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. The specific type designation for the entity as defined by its provider or system. This field provides more granular classification than the type field. Examples: aws_s3_bucket, gcp_cloud_storage_bucket, azure_blob_container would all map to entity type bucket. hardware , virtual , container , node , cloud_instance would all map to entity type host.

type: keyword

example: aws_s3_bucket

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. A standardized high-level classification of the entity. This provides a normalized way to group similar entities across different providers or systems. Example values: bucket, database, container, function, queue, host, user, application, session, cloud, orchestrator, etc. If an entity is nested under a top-level namespace like host or cloud, or similar, its type array should include the matching value for example, host or cloud.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

Important: The field value must be one of the following:

bucket, database, container, function, queue, host, user, application, service, session, cloud, orchestrator

To learn more about when to use which value, visit the page allowed values for entity.type

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. A set of static or semi-static attributes of the entity. Usually boolean or keyword field data types. Use this field set when you need to track static or semi-static characteristics of an entity for advanced searching and correlation of normalized values across different providers/sources and entity types.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. A set of ephemeral characteristics of the entity, derived from observed behaviors during a specific time period. Usually boolean field data type. Use this field set when you need to capture and track ephemeral characteristics of an entity for advanced searching, correlation of normalized values across different providers/sources and entity types.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. An optional field used when a pretty name is desired for entity-centric operations. This field should not be used for correlation with *.name fields for entities with dedicated field sets (e.g., host).

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

* entity.display_name.text (type: match_only_text)

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A unique identifier for the entity. When multiple identifiers exist, this should be the most stable and commonly used identifier that: 1) persists across the entity's lifecycle, 2) ensures uniqueness within its scope, 3) is commonly used for queries and correlation, and 4) is readily available in most observations (logs/events). For entities with dedicated field sets (e.g., host, user), this value should match the corresponding *.id field. Alternative identifiers (e.g., ARNs values in AWS, URLs) can be preserved in the raw field.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. Indicates the date/time when this entity was last "seen," usually based upon the last event/log that is initiated by this entity.

type: date

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. A set of temporal characteristics of the entity. Usually date field data type. Use this field set when you need to track temporal characteristics of an entity for advanced searching and correlation of normalized values across different providers/sources and entity types.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. Field set for any fields containing numeric entity metrics. These use dynamic field data type mapping.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. The name of the entity. The keyword field enables exact matches for filtering and aggregations, while the text field enables full-text search. For entities with dedicated field sets (e.g., host), this field should mirrors the corresponding .name value.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

entity.name.text (type: match_only_text)

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. Original, unmodified fields from the source system. Usually flattened field data type. While the attributes field should be used for normalized fields requiring advanced queries, this field preserves all source metadata with basic search capabilities.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. A URI, URL, or other direct reference to access or locate the entity in its source system. This could be an API endpoint, web console URL, or other addressable location. Format may vary by entity type and source system.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. The module or integration that provided this entity data (similar to event.module).

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. The specific type designation for the entity as defined by its provider or system. This field provides more granular classification than the type field. Examples: aws_s3_bucket, gcp_cloud_storage_bucket, azure_blob_container would all map to entity type bucket. hardware , virtual , container , node , cloud_instance would all map to entity type host.

type: keyword

example: aws_s3_bucket

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. A standardized high-level classification of the entity. This provides a normalized way to group similar entities across different providers or systems. Example values: bucket, database, container, function, queue, host, user, application, session, cloud, orchestrator, etc. If an entity is nested under a top-level namespace like host or cloud, or similar, its type array should include the matching value for example, host or cloud.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

Important: The field value must be one of the following:

bucket, database, container, function, queue, host, user, application, service, session, cloud, orchestrator

To learn more about when to use which value, visit the page allowed values for entity.type

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Name of the directory the group is a member of.

For example, an LDAP or Active Directory domain name.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Unique identifier for the group on the system/platform.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Name of the group.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A risk classification level calculated by an internal system as part of entity analytics and entity risk scoring.

type: keyword

example: High

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A risk classification score calculated by an internal system as part of entity analytics and entity risk scoring.

type: float

example: 880.73

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A risk classification score calculated by an internal system as part of entity analytics and entity risk scoring, and normalized to a range of 0 to 100.

type: float

example: 88.73

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A risk classification level obtained from outside the system, such as from some external Threat Intelligence Platform.

type: keyword

example: High

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A risk classification score obtained from outside the system, such as from some external Threat Intelligence Platform.

type: float

example: 830.0

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A risk classification score obtained from outside the system, such as from some external Threat Intelligence Platform, and normalized to a range of 0 to 100.

type: float

example: 83.0

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Name of the directory the user is a member of.

For example, an LDAP or Active Directory domain name.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
User email address.

type: keyword

user.email

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
User's full name, if available.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

* user.full_name.text (type: match_only_text)

example: Albert Einstein

user.full_name

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Unique user hash to correlate information for a user in anonymized form.

Useful if user.id or user.name contain confidential information and cannot be used.

type: keyword

user.hash

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Unique identifier of the user.

type: keyword

example: S-1-5-21-202424912787-2692429404-2351956786-1000

user.id

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Short name or login of the user.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

* user.name.text (type: match_only_text)

example: a.einstein

user.name

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Array of user roles at the time of the event.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

example: ["kibana_admin", "reporting_user"]

user.roles

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The hashing algorithm used to sign the process.

This value can distinguish signatures when a file is signed multiple times by the same signer but with a different digest algorithm.

type: keyword

example: sha256

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Boolean to capture if a signature is present.

type: boolean

example: true

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. The flags used to sign the process.

type: keyword

example: 570522385

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The identifier used to sign the process.

This is used to identify the application manufactured by a software vendor. The field is relevant to Apple *OS only.

type: keyword

example: com.apple.xpc.proxy

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Additional information about the certificate status.

This is useful for logging cryptographic errors with the certificate validity or trust status. Leave unpopulated if the validity or trust of the certificate was unchecked.

type: keyword

example: ERROR_UNTRUSTED_ROOT

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Subject name of the code signer

type: keyword

example: Microsoft Corporation

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The team identifier used to sign the process.

This is used to identify the team or vendor of a software product. The field is relevant to Apple *OS only.

type: keyword

example: EQHXZ8M8AV

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. Certificate SHA256 hash that uniquely identifies the code signer.

type: keyword

example: c0f23a8eb1cba0ccaa88483b5a234c96e4bdfec719bf458024e68c2a8183476b

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Date and time when the code signature was generated and signed.

type: date

example: 2021-01-01T12:10:30Z

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Stores the trust status of the certificate chain.

Validating the trust of the certificate chain may be complicated, and this field should only be populated by tools that actively check the status.

type: boolean

example: true

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Boolean to capture if the digital signature is verified against the binary content.

Leave unpopulated if a certificate was unchecked.

type: boolean

example: true

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Machine architecture of the ELF file.

type: keyword

example: x86-64

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Byte sequence of ELF file.

type: keyword

example: Little Endian

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
CPU type of the ELF file.

type: keyword

example: Intel

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Extracted when possible from the file's metadata. Indicates when it was built or compiled. It can also be faked by malware creators.

type: date

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
List of exported element names and types.

type: flattened

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A hash of the Go language imports in an ELF file excluding standard library imports. An import hash can be used to fingerprint binaries even after recompilation or other code-level transformations have occurred, which would change more traditional hash values.

The algorithm used to calculate the Go symbol hash and a reference implementation are available here: https://github.com/elastic/toutoumomoma

type: keyword

example: 10bddcb4cee42080f76c88d9ff964491

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
List of imported Go language element names and types.

type: flattened

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Shannon entropy calculation from the list of Go imports.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Variance for Shannon entropy calculation from the list of Go imports.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Set to true if the file is a Go executable that has had its symbols stripped or obfuscated and false if an unobfuscated Go executable.

type: boolean

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Version of the ELF Application Binary Interface (ABI).

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Header class of the ELF file.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Data table of the ELF header.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Header entrypoint of the ELF file.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
"0x1" for original ELF files.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Application Binary Interface (ABI) of the Linux OS.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Header type of the ELF file.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Version of the ELF header.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A hash of the imports in an ELF file. An import hash can be used to fingerprint binaries even after recompilation or other code-level transformations have occurred, which would change more traditional hash values.

This is an ELF implementation of the Windows PE imphash.

type: keyword

example: d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
List of imported element names and types.

type: flattened

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Shannon entropy calculation from the list of imported element names and types.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Variance for Shannon entropy calculation from the list of imported element names and types.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
An array containing an object for each section of the ELF file.

The keys that should be present in these objects are defined by sub-fields underneath elf.sections.*.

type: nested

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Chi-square probability distribution of the section.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Shannon entropy calculation from the section.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
ELF Section List flags.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
ELF Section List name.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
ELF Section List offset.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
ELF Section List physical size.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
ELF Section List type.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Variance for Shannon entropy calculation from the section.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
ELF Section List virtual address.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
ELF Section List virtual size.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
An array containing an object for each segment of the ELF file.

The keys that should be present in these objects are defined by sub-fields underneath elf.segments.*.

type: nested

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
ELF object segment sections.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
ELF object segment type.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
List of shared libraries used by this ELF object.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
telfhash symbol hash for ELF file.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Array of process arguments, starting with the absolute path to the executable.

May be filtered to protect sensitive information.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

example: ["/usr/bin/ssh", "-l", "user", "10.0.0.16"]

process.command_args

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Length of the process.args array.

This field can be useful for querying or performing bucket analysis on how many arguments were provided to start a process. More arguments may be an indication of suspicious activity.

type: long

example: 4

process.args_count

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Full command line that started the process, including the absolute path to the executable, and all arguments.

Some arguments may be filtered to protect sensitive information.

type: wildcard

Multi-fields:

* process.command_line.text (type: match_only_text)

example: /usr/bin/ssh -l user 10.0.0.16

process.command_line

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The time the process ended.

type: date

example: 2016-05-23T08:05:34.853Z

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Unique identifier for the process.

The implementation of this is specified by the data source, but some examples of what could be used here are a process-generated UUID, Sysmon Process GUIDs, or a hash of some uniquely identifying components of a process.

Constructing a globally unique identifier is a common practice to mitigate PID reuse as well as to identify a specific process over time, across multiple monitored hosts.

type: keyword

example: c2c455d9f99375d

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Array of environment variable bindings. Captured from a snapshot of the environment at the time of execution.

May be filtered to protect sensitive information.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

example: ["PATH=/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin", "USER=ubuntu"]

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Absolute path to the process executable.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

* process.executable.text (type: match_only_text)

example: /usr/bin/ssh

process.executable.path

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The exit code of the process, if this is a termination event.

The field should be absent if there is no exit code for the event (e.g. process start).

type: long

example: 137

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Whether the process is connected to an interactive shell.

Process interactivity is inferred from the processes file descriptors. If the character device for the controlling tty is the same as stdin and stderr for the process, the process is considered interactive.

Note: A non-interactive process can belong to an interactive session and is simply one that does not have open file descriptors reading the controlling TTY on FD 0 (stdin) or writing to the controlling TTY on FD 2 (stderr). A backgrounded process is still considered interactive if stdin and stderr are connected to the controlling TTY.

type: boolean

example: True

process.interactive

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A chunk of input or output (IO) from a single process.

This field only appears on the top level process object, which is the process that wrote the output or read the input.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
An array of byte offsets and lengths denoting where IO data has been skipped.

type: object

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The length of bytes skipped.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The byte offset into this event's io.text (or io.bytes in the future) where length bytes were skipped.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
If true, the process producing the output has exceeded the max_kilobytes_per_process configuration setting.

type: boolean

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A chunk of output or input sanitized to UTF-8.

Best efforts are made to ensure complete lines are captured in these events. Assumptions should NOT be made that multiple lines will appear in the same event. TTY output may contain terminal control codes such as for cursor movement, so some string queries may not match due to terminal codes inserted between characters of a word.

type: wildcard

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The total number of bytes captured in this event.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The total number of bytes that were not captured due to implementation restrictions such as buffer size limits. Implementors should strive to ensure this value is always zero

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The type of object on which the IO action (read or write) was taken.

Currently only 'tty' is supported. Other types may be added in the future for 'file' and 'socket' support.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Process name.

Sometimes called program name or similar.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

* process.name.text (type: match_only_text)

example: ssh

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Process id.

type: long

example: 4242

process.pid

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The time the process started.

type: date

example: 2016-05-23T08:05:34.853Z

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This is the set of capabilities used by the kernel to perform permission checks for the thread.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

example: ["CAP_BPF", "CAP_SYS_ADMIN"]

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This is a limiting superset for the effective capabilities that the thread may assume.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

example: ["CAP_BPF", "CAP_SYS_ADMIN"]

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Thread ID.

type: long

example: 4242

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Thread name.

type: keyword

example: thread-0

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Process title.

The proctitle, some times the same as process name. Can also be different: for example a browser setting its title to the web page currently opened.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

* process.title.text (type: match_only_text)

process.title

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Information about the controlling TTY device. If set, the process belongs to an interactive session.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The major number identifies the driver associated with the device. The character device's major and minor numbers can be algorithmically combined to produce the more familiar terminal identifiers such as "ttyS0" and "pts/0". For more details, please refer to the Linux kernel documentation.

type: long

example: 4

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The minor number is used only by the driver specified by the major number; other parts of the kernel dont use it, and merely pass it along to the driver. It is common for a driver to control several devices; the minor number provides a way for the driver to differentiate among them.

type: long

example: 1

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The number of character columns per line. e.g terminal width

Terminal sizes can change, so this value reflects the maximum value for a given IO event. i.e. where event.action = 'text_output'

type: long

example: 80

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The number of character rows in the terminal. e.g terminal height

Terminal sizes can change, so this value reflects the maximum value for a given IO event. i.e. where event.action = 'text_output'

type: long

example: 24

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Seconds the process has been up.

type: long

example: 1325

process.uptime

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Virtual process id.

The process id within a pid namespace. This is not necessarily unique across all processes on the host but it is unique within the process namespace that the process exists within.

type: long

example: 4242

process.vpid

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The working directory of the process.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

* process.working_directory.text (type: match_only_text)

example: /home/alice

process.working_directory

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Array of process arguments, starting with the absolute path to the executable.

May be filtered to protect sensitive information.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

example: ["/usr/bin/ssh", "-l", "user", "10.0.0.16"]

process.command_args

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Length of the process.args array.

This field can be useful for querying or performing bucket analysis on how many arguments were provided to start a process. More arguments may be an indication of suspicious activity.

type: long

example: 4

process.args_count

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Full command line that started the process, including the absolute path to the executable, and all arguments.

Some arguments may be filtered to protect sensitive information.

type: wildcard

Multi-fields:

* process.command_line.text (type: match_only_text)

example: /usr/bin/ssh -l user 10.0.0.16

process.command_line

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The time the process ended.

type: date

example: 2016-05-23T08:05:34.853Z

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Unique identifier for the process.

The implementation of this is specified by the data source, but some examples of what could be used here are a process-generated UUID, Sysmon Process GUIDs, or a hash of some uniquely identifying components of a process.

Constructing a globally unique identifier is a common practice to mitigate PID reuse as well as to identify a specific process over time, across multiple monitored hosts.

type: keyword

example: c2c455d9f99375d

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Array of environment variable bindings. Captured from a snapshot of the environment at the time of execution.

May be filtered to protect sensitive information.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

example: ["PATH=/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin", "USER=ubuntu"]

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Absolute path to the process executable.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

* process.executable.text (type: match_only_text)

example: /usr/bin/ssh

process.executable.path

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The exit code of the process, if this is a termination event.

The field should be absent if there is no exit code for the event (e.g. process start).

type: long

example: 137

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Whether the process is connected to an interactive shell.

Process interactivity is inferred from the processes file descriptors. If the character device for the controlling tty is the same as stdin and stderr for the process, the process is considered interactive.

Note: A non-interactive process can belong to an interactive session and is simply one that does not have open file descriptors reading the controlling TTY on FD 0 (stdin) or writing to the controlling TTY on FD 2 (stderr). A backgrounded process is still considered interactive if stdin and stderr are connected to the controlling TTY.

type: boolean

example: True

process.interactive

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A chunk of input or output (IO) from a single process.

This field only appears on the top level process object, which is the process that wrote the output or read the input.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
An array of byte offsets and lengths denoting where IO data has been skipped.

type: object

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The length of bytes skipped.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The byte offset into this event's io.text (or io.bytes in the future) where length bytes were skipped.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
If true, the process producing the output has exceeded the max_kilobytes_per_process configuration setting.

type: boolean

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A chunk of output or input sanitized to UTF-8.

Best efforts are made to ensure complete lines are captured in these events. Assumptions should NOT be made that multiple lines will appear in the same event. TTY output may contain terminal control codes such as for cursor movement, so some string queries may not match due to terminal codes inserted between characters of a word.

type: wildcard

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The total number of bytes captured in this event.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The total number of bytes that were not captured due to implementation restrictions such as buffer size limits. Implementors should strive to ensure this value is always zero

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The type of object on which the IO action (read or write) was taken.

Currently only 'tty' is supported. Other types may be added in the future for 'file' and 'socket' support.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Process name.

Sometimes called program name or similar.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

example: ssh

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>

Process id.

example: 4242

process.pid

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The time the process started.

type: date

example: 2016-05-23T08:05:34.853Z

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

example: ["CAP_BPF", "CAP_SYS_ADMIN"]

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:

type: keyword

example: ["CAP_BPF", "CAP_SYS_ADMIN"]

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>

example: 4242

fieldDescription:
Process title.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

process.title

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Information about the controlling TTY device. If set, the process belongs to an interactive session.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The major number identifies the driver associated with the device. The character device's major and minor numbers can be algorithmically combined to produce the more familiar terminal identifiers such as "ttyS0" and "pts/0". For more details, please refer to the Linux kernel documentation.

type: long

example: 4

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The minor number is used only by the driver specified by the major number; other parts of the kernel dont use it, and merely pass it along to the driver. It is common for a driver to control several devices; the minor number provides a way for the driver to differentiate among them.

type: long

example: 1

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The number of character columns per line. e.g terminal width

Terminal sizes can change, so this value reflects the maximum value for a given IO event. i.e. where event.action = 'text_output'

type: long

example: 80

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The number of character rows in the terminal. e.g terminal height

Terminal sizes can change, so this value reflects the maximum value for a given IO event. i.e. where event.action = 'text_output'

type: long

example: 24

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Seconds the process has been up.

type: long

example: 1325

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:

type: long

example: 4242

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Some event source addresses are defined ambiguously. The event will sometimes list an IP, a domain or a unix socket. You should always store the raw address in the .address field.

Then it should be duplicated to .ip or .domain, depending on which one it is.

type: keyword

source.address

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Bytes sent from the source to the destination.

type: long

example: 184

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The domain name of the source system.

This value may be a host name, a fully qualified domain name, or another host naming format. The value may derive from the original event or be added from enrichment.

type: keyword

example: foo.example.com

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
IP address of the source (IPv4 or IPv6).

type: ip

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
MAC address of the source.

The notation format from RFC 7042 is suggested: Each octet (that is, 8-bit byte) is represented by two [uppercase] hexadecimal digits giving the value of the octet as an unsigned integer. Successive octets are separated by a hyphen.

type: keyword

example: 00-00-5E-00-53-23

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Translated ip of source based NAT sessions (e.g. internal client to internet)

Typically connections traversing load balancers, firewalls, or routers.

type: ip

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Translated port of source based NAT sessions. (e.g. internal client to internet)

Typically used with load balancers, firewalls, or routers.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Packets sent from the source to the destination.

type: long

example: 12

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Port of the source.

type: long

source.port

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The highest registered source domain, stripped of the subdomain.

For example, the registered domain for "foo.example.com" is "example.com".

This value can be determined precisely with a list like the public suffix list (https://publicsuffix.org). Trying to approximate this by simply taking the last two labels will not work well for TLDs such as "co.uk".

type: keyword

example: example.com

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The subdomain portion of a fully qualified domain name includes all of the names except the host name under the registered_domain. In a partially qualified domain, or if the the qualification level of the full name cannot be determined, subdomain contains all of the names below the registered domain.

For example the subdomain portion of "www.east.mydomain.co.uk" is "east". If the domain has multiple levels of subdomain, such as "sub2.sub1.example.com", the subdomain field should contain "sub2.sub1", with no trailing period.

type: keyword

example: east

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The effective top level domain (eTLD), also known as the domain suffix, is the last part of the domain name. For example, the top level domain for example.com is "com".

This value can be determined precisely with a list like the public suffix list (https://publicsuffix.org). Trying to approximate this by simply taking the last label will not work well for effective TLDs such as "co.uk".

type: keyword

example: co.uk

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Unique number allocated to the autonomous system. The autonomous system number (ASN) uniquely identifies each network on the Internet.

type: long

example: 15169

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Organization name.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

* as.organization.name.text (type: match_only_text)

example: Google LLC

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>

City name.

type: keyword

example: Montreal

geo.locality.name

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>

Two-letter code representing continent's name.

type: keyword

example: NA

geo.continent.code

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Name of the continent.

type: keyword

example: North America

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Country ISO code.

type: keyword

example: CA

geo.country.iso_code

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Country name.

type: keyword

example: Canada

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Longitude and latitude.

type: geo_point

example: { "lon": -73.614830, "lat": 45.505918 }

geo.location.lon

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
User-defined description of a location, at the level of granularity they care about.

Could be the name of their data centers, the floor number, if this describes a local physical entity, city names.

Not typically used in automated geolocation.

type: keyword

example: boston-dc

Values appropriate for this field may also be known as a postcode or ZIP code and will vary widely from country to country.

type: keyword

example: 94040

geo.postal_code

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Region ISO code.

type: keyword

example: CA-QC

geo.region.iso_code

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Region name.

type: keyword

example: Quebec

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The time zone of the location, such as IANA time zone name.

type: keyword

example: America/Argentina/Buenos_Aires

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
User email address.

user.email

example: ["/usr/bin/ssh", "-l", "user", "10.0.0.16"]

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Length of the process.args array.

This field can be useful for querying or performing bucket analysis on how many arguments were provided to start a process. More arguments may be an indication of suspicious activity.

type: long

example: 4

process.args_count

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Full command line that started the process, including the absolute path to the executable, and all arguments.

Some arguments may be filtered to protect sensitive information.

type: wildcard

Multi-fields:

* process.command_line.text (type: match_only_text)

example: /usr/bin/ssh -l user 10.0.0.16

process.command_line

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The time the process ended.

type: date

example: 2016-05-23T08:05:34.853Z

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Unique identifier for the process.

The implementation of this is specified by the data source, but some examples of what could be used here are a process-generated UUID, Sysmon Process GUIDs, or a hash of some uniquely identifying components of a process.

Constructing a globally unique identifier is a common practice to mitigate PID reuse as well as to identify a specific process over time, across multiple monitored hosts.

type: keyword

example: c2c455d9f99375d

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Array of environment variable bindings. Captured from a snapshot of the environment at the time of execution.

May be filtered to protect sensitive information.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

example: ["PATH=/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin", "USER=ubuntu"]

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Absolute path to the process executable.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

* process.executable.text (type: match_only_text)

example: /usr/bin/ssh

process.executable.path

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The exit code of the process, if this is a termination event.

The field should be absent if there is no exit code for the event (e.g. process start).

type: long

example: 137

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Whether the process is connected to an interactive shell.

Process interactivity is inferred from the processes file descriptors. If the character device for the controlling tty is the same as stdin and stderr for the process, the process is considered interactive.

Note: A non-interactive process can belong to an interactive session and is simply one that does not have open file descriptors reading the controlling TTY on FD 0 (stdin) or writing to the controlling TTY on FD 2 (stderr). A backgrounded process is still considered interactive if stdin and stderr are connected to the controlling TTY.

type: boolean

example: True

process.interactive

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A chunk of input or output (IO) from a single process.

This field only appears on the top level process object, which is the process that wrote the output or read the input.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
An array of byte offsets and lengths denoting where IO data has been skipped.

type: object

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The length of bytes skipped.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The byte offset into this event's io.text (or io.bytes in the future) where length bytes were skipped.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
If true, the process producing the output has exceeded the max_kilobytes_per_process configuration setting.

type: boolean

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A chunk of output or input sanitized to UTF-8.

Best efforts are made to ensure complete lines are captured in these events. Assumptions should NOT be made that multiple lines will appear in the same event. TTY output may contain terminal control codes such as for cursor movement, so some string queries may not match due to terminal codes inserted between characters of a word.

type: wildcard

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The total number of bytes captured in this event.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The total number of bytes that were not captured due to implementation restrictions such as buffer size limits. Implementors should strive to ensure this value is always zero

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The type of object on which the IO action (read or write) was taken.

Currently only 'tty' is supported. Other types may be added in the future for 'file' and 'socket' support.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Process name.

Sometimes called program name or similar.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

* process.name.text (type: match_only_text)

example: ssh

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Process id.

type: long

example: 4242

process.pid

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The time the process started.

type: date

example: 2016-05-23T08:05:34.853Z

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This is the set of capabilities used by the kernel to perform permission checks for the thread.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

example: ["CAP_BPF", "CAP_SYS_ADMIN"]

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This is a limiting superset for the effective capabilities that the thread may assume.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

example: ["CAP_BPF", "CAP_SYS_ADMIN"]

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Thread ID.

type: long

example: 4242

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Thread name.

type: keyword

example: thread-0

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Process title.

The proctitle, some times the same as process name. Can also be different: for example a browser setting its title to the web page currently opened.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

* process.title.text (type: match_only_text)

process.title

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Information about the controlling TTY device. If set, the process belongs to an interactive session.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The major number identifies the driver associated with the device. The character device's major and minor numbers can be algorithmically combined to produce the more familiar terminal identifiers such as "ttyS0" and "pts/0". For more details, please refer to the Linux kernel documentation.

type: long

example: 4

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The minor number is used only by the driver specified by the major number; other parts of the kernel dont use it, and merely pass it along to the driver. It is common for a driver to control several devices; the minor number provides a way for the driver to differentiate among them.

type: long

example: 1

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The number of character columns per line. e.g terminal width

Terminal sizes can change, so this value reflects the maximum value for a given IO event. i.e. where event.action = 'text_output'

type: long

example: 80

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The number of character rows in the terminal. e.g terminal height

Terminal sizes can change, so this value reflects the maximum value for a given IO event. i.e. where event.action = 'text_output'

type: long

example: 24

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Seconds the process has been up.

type: long

example: 1325

process.uptime

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Virtual process id.

The process id within a pid namespace. This is not necessarily unique across all processes on the host but it is unique within the process namespace that the process exists within.

type: long

example: 4242

process.vpid

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:

type: keyword

* process.working_directory.text (type: match_only_text)

example: /home/alice

process.working_directory

fieldDescription:
This field is beta and subject to change. Code directory hash, utilized to uniquely identify and authenticate the integrity of the executable code.

type: keyword

example: 3783b4052fd474dbe30676b45c329e7a6d44acd9

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
MD5 hash.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
SHA1 hash.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
SHA256 hash.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
SHA512 hash.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
SSDEEP hash.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
TLSH hash.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A hash of the Go language imports in a Mach-O file excluding standard library imports. An import hash can be used to fingerprint binaries even after recompilation or other code-level transformations have occurred, which would change more traditional hash values.

The algorithm used to calculate the Go symbol hash and a reference implementation are available here: https://github.com/elastic/toutoumomoma

type: keyword

example: 10bddcb4cee42080f76c88d9ff964491

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
List of imported Go language element names and types.

type: flattened

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Shannon entropy calculation from the list of Go imports.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Variance for Shannon entropy calculation from the list of Go imports.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Set to true if the file is a Go executable that has had its symbols stripped or obfuscated and false if an unobfuscated Go executable.

type: boolean

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A hash of the imports in a Mach-O file. An import hash can be used to fingerprint binaries even after recompilation or other code-level transformations have occurred, which would change more traditional hash values.

This is a synonym for symhash.

type: keyword

example: d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
List of imported element names and types.

type: flattened

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Shannon entropy calculation from the list of imported element names and types.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Variance for Shannon entropy calculation from the list of imported element names and types.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
An array containing an object for each section of the Mach-O file.

The keys that should be present in these objects are defined by sub-fields underneath macho.sections.*.

type: nested

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Shannon entropy calculation from the section.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Mach-O Section List name.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Mach-O Section List physical size.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Variance for Shannon entropy calculation from the section.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Mach-O Section List virtual size. This is always the same as physical_size.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A hash of the imports in a Mach-O file. An import hash can be used to fingerprint binaries even after recompilation or other code-level transformations have occurred, which would change more traditional hash values.

This is a Mach-O implementation of the Windows PE imphash

type: keyword

example: d3ccf195b62a9279c3c19af1080497ec

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Array of process arguments, starting with the absolute path to the executable.

May be filtered to protect sensitive information.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

example: ["/usr/bin/ssh", "-l", "user", "10.0.0.16"]

process.command_args

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Length of the process.args array.

This field can be useful for querying or performing bucket analysis on how many arguments were provided to start a process. More arguments may be an indication of suspicious activity.

type: long

example: 4

process.args_count

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Full command line that started the process, including the absolute path to the executable, and all arguments.

Some arguments may be filtered to protect sensitive information.

type: wildcard

Multi-fields:

* process.command_line.text (type: match_only_text)

example: /usr/bin/ssh -l user 10.0.0.16

process.command_line

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The time the process ended.

type: date

example: 2016-05-23T08:05:34.853Z

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Unique identifier for the process.

The implementation of this is specified by the data source, but some examples of what could be used here are a process-generated UUID, Sysmon Process GUIDs, or a hash of some uniquely identifying components of a process.

Constructing a globally unique identifier is a common practice to mitigate PID reuse as well as to identify a specific process over time, across multiple monitored hosts.

type: keyword

example: c2c455d9f99375d

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Array of environment variable bindings. Captured from a snapshot of the environment at the time of execution.

May be filtered to protect sensitive information.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

example: ["PATH=/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin", "USER=ubuntu"]

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Absolute path to the process executable.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

* process.executable.text (type: match_only_text)

example: /usr/bin/ssh

process.executable.path

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The exit code of the process, if this is a termination event.

The field should be absent if there is no exit code for the event (e.g. process start).

type: long

example: 137

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Whether the process is connected to an interactive shell.

Process interactivity is inferred from the processes file descriptors. If the character device for the controlling tty is the same as stdin and stderr for the process, the process is considered interactive.

Note: A non-interactive process can belong to an interactive session and is simply one that does not have open file descriptors reading the controlling TTY on FD 0 (stdin) or writing to the controlling TTY on FD 2 (stderr). A backgrounded process is still considered interactive if stdin and stderr are connected to the controlling TTY.

type: boolean

example: True

process.interactive

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A chunk of input or output (IO) from a single process.

This field only appears on the top level process object, which is the process that wrote the output or read the input.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
An array of byte offsets and lengths denoting where IO data has been skipped.

type: object

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The length of bytes skipped.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The byte offset into this event's io.text (or io.bytes in the future) where length bytes were skipped.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
If true, the process producing the output has exceeded the max_kilobytes_per_process configuration setting.

type: boolean

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
A chunk of output or input sanitized to UTF-8.

Best efforts are made to ensure complete lines are captured in these events. Assumptions should NOT be made that multiple lines will appear in the same event. TTY output may contain terminal control codes such as for cursor movement, so some string queries may not match due to terminal codes inserted between characters of a word.

type: wildcard

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The total number of bytes captured in this event.

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The total number of bytes that were not captured due to implementation restrictions such as buffer size limits. Implementors should strive to ensure this value is always zero

type: long

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The type of object on which the IO action (read or write) was taken.

Currently only 'tty' is supported. Other types may be added in the future for 'file' and 'socket' support.

type: keyword

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Process name.

Sometimes called program name or similar.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

* process.name.text (type: match_only_text)

example: ssh

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Process id.

type: long

example: 4242

process.pid

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The time the process started.

type: date

example: 2016-05-23T08:05:34.853Z

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This is the set of capabilities used by the kernel to perform permission checks for the thread.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

example: ["CAP_BPF", "CAP_SYS_ADMIN"]

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
This is a limiting superset for the effective capabilities that the thread may assume.

type: keyword

Note: This field should contain an array of values.

example: ["CAP_BPF", "CAP_SYS_ADMIN"]

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Thread ID.

type: long

example: 4242

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Thread name.

example: thread-0

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Process title.

The proctitle, some times the same as process name. Can also be different: for example a browser setting its title to the web page currently opened.

type: keyword

Multi-fields:

* process.title.text (type: match_only_text)

process.title

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Information about the controlling TTY device. If set, the process belongs to an interactive session.

type: object

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The major number identifies the driver associated with the device. The character device's major and minor numbers can be algorithmically combined to produce the more familiar terminal identifiers such as "ttyS0" and "pts/0". For more details, please refer to the Linux kernel documentation.

type: long

example: 4

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The minor number is used only by the driver specified by the major number; other parts of the kernel dont use it, and merely pass it along to the driver. It is common for a driver to control several devices; the minor number provides a way for the driver to differentiate among them.

type: long

example: 1

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The number of character columns per line. e.g terminal width

Terminal sizes can change, so this value reflects the maximum value for a given IO event. i.e. where event.action = 'text_output'

type: long

example: 80

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
The number of character rows in the terminal. e.g terminal height

Terminal sizes can change, so this value reflects the maximum value for a given IO event. i.e. where event.action = 'text_output'

type: long

example: 24

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Seconds the process has been up.

type: long

example: 1325

process.uptime

fieldSet: <abbr title='These fields contain information about a process.'>Process</abbr>
fieldDescription:
Virtual process id.

The process id within a pid namespace. This is not necessarily unique across all processes on the host but it is unique within the process namespace that the process exists within.

type: long

example: 4242

process.vpid
